title: 2 FONT I.D's NEEDED - one serif font and one 1970's font as used by Flora
content:
can anyone identify these two fonts?  
please click the link to view  
thankyou

[http://img508.imageshack.us/img508/207/picture1fv7.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20091025084458/http:/img508.imageshack.us/img508/207/picture1fv7.jpg "http://img508.imageshack.us/img508/207/picture1fv7.jpg")
author: hellomatt

comments.content:
The rounded green one is [’Octopuss’](http://web.archive.org/web/20091025084458/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/octopuss/) by Colin Brignall.

- Mike Yanega

I mean Didoni, not Didot. Apologies.

Rats. I hate that bug that sends all edited messages to the bottom.

Me too, but they don’t seem inclined to fix it. I’ve complained and I know others have too. I end up putting the link in a separate post so as not to lose my place in line.

I think Yves should put all 4 of our names in the ID ;-)
pattyfab, you are so sweet! But truth be told your knowledge far surpasses mine. (Not to mention your typing skills.)
No YOU’RE sweet. I only remembered this font because it came up very recently, it’s not normally on my radar much.
hellomatt - what’s the source of these images?

no vector font is from Grafik Aug 07 issue.  
the other one is a scan from an 80’s teenagers annual.

The hand-drawn effect in no vector font is from [http://www.fontself.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20091025084458/http:/www.fontself.com/ "http://www.fontself.com") they design handwritten fonts using a type tool they created.
